meanings.definition: To inoculate with smallpox virus to produce immunity.
meanings.sent1: The doctor variolated the child to protect them from smallpox.
meanings.sent2: In the past, people variolated themselves to prevent getting sick.
meanings.sent3: The scientist variolated the mice in the lab, but they all ended up with tiny superhero capes!
meanings.sent4: She variolated her garden with fertilizer, hoping to boost the plants' growth like a magical potion.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tradition of variolating against smallpox has saved countless lives throughout history.

meanings.definition: Having been inoculated with smallpox virus.
meanings.sent1: The variolated individuals were considered immune to smallpox.
meanings.sent2: The variolated patients showed no signs of the disease after exposure.
meanings.sent3: The variolated group at the party joked about forming a secret society of the immune.
meanings.sent4: The variolated population stood strong against the smallpox outbreak, like an army of shielded warriors.
meanings.sent5: The variolated children skipped happily in the sunshine, protected from the threat of smallpox.
